issue.message: OpenAPI spec '../oak/apis/openapi/facecheck.id/main/v1.02/openapi.json' must define at least one server in the 'servers' array.

repairs.llm_prompt:
Return your answer in the following JSON format (as a code block):

{
    "success": <true/false>,
    "output": "<updated_dict>"
}The OpenAPI spec is missing a server URL. Please provide only the URL, and only the URL, as a string. 
NEVER return example URLs like example.com, localhost, or 123.com. If unsure, simply fail the request.
If an API already has a partial server URL that partial server URL should be used. Eg. /rest should be https://api.example.com/rest.
repairs.llm_response:
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "output": "https://facecheck.id"
}
```

Explanation: I was able to determine the base URL from the contact.url field and api info description which points to facecheck.id. The company's brand name and domain is clearly FaceCheck.ID and is referenced multiple times.
